--Examples--
--Word--
oxycephaly 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
The condition of having a head or skull that is abnormally high and pointed in shape; specifically a congenital malformation of the skull characterized by an abnormally high forehead, reduced sagittal diameter, and pointed bregmatic region, resulting from premature closure of both coronal, and sometimes the sagittal and lambdoidal, sutures.
--Examples--
--Word--
oxycephalic 
--Type--
adjective
--Meanings--
Having or designating a skull or head of abnormally pointed or conical shape; affected by oxycephaly. Also as noun: a person with oxycephaly.

--Word--
oxidize 
--Type--
verb
--Meanings--
Combine chemically with oxygen.
Undergo or cause to undergo a reaction in which electrons are lost to another species.
--Examples--
‘when coal is burnt any sulphur is oxidized to sulphur dioxide’
‘the fats in the food will oxidize, turning it rancid’
‘iron (ii) compounds are slowly oxidized by air to form iron (III) compounds’
‘secondary alcohols oxidize to give ketones’

noun

noun

--Word--
oxygen 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
A colourless, odourless reactive gas, the chemical element of atomic number 8 and the life-supporting component of the air.
--Examples--
‘if breathing stops, there is no oxygen getting to the brain and the cells begin to die’
‘hydrogen and carbon in the fuel combine with the oxygen in the air to form carbon dioxide and water’
‘an oxygen supply’
--Word--
acetylene 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
A colourless pungent-smelling hydrocarbon gas, which burns with a bright flame, used in welding and formerly in lighting.
--Examples--
--Word--
oxygenase 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
Originally: any oxidase producing hydrogen peroxide. Now: any enzyme which brings about the incorporation of molecular oxygen into a substrate.

--Word--
Oxytropis 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
A large genus of the family Fabaceae (Leguminosae), of the north temperate zone, which consists of low-growing, often alpine plants, with pinnate leaves and racemes of purple, white, or yellow flowers; (also oxytropis) a plant of this genus (also called milk-vetch).

--Word--
oxonic acid 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
An acid, C₄H₃N₃O₄, whose structure is a ring consisting of two carbonyl groups, two imine groups, and a carbon atom attached via a nitrogen atom to a carboxyl group.
--Examples--
--Word--
oxonium 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
The hydroxonium ion, H₃O+; any analogue of this in which one or more of the hydrogen atoms are replaced by organic groups. Usually attributive.
--Examples--

--Type--
abbreviation
--Meanings--
Ounce(s).
--Examples--
--Word--
ozaena 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
Medicine. Originally: an ulcer of the nose (or, rarely, other part of the body), especially when accompanied by a fetid discharge; any of various conditions characterized by the presence of such a lesion. Later: specifically a chronic disease of the nose characterized by atrophy of the nasal mucosa and bone, with a thick secretion that forms dry, extremely fetid crusts, often associated with the presence of bacteria of the genus Klebsiella.
--Examples--
--Word--
ozaena 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
Medicine. Originally: an ulcer of the nose (or, rarely, other part of the body), especially when accompanied by a fetid discharge; any of various conditions characterized by the presence of such a lesion. Later: specifically a chronic disease of the nose characterized by atrophy of the nasal mucosa and bone, with a thick secretion that forms dry, extremely fetid crusts, often associated with the presence of bacteria of the genus Klebsiella.
--Examples--
--Word--
Ozalid 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
A photocopy made by a process in which a diazonium salt and coupler are present in the paper coating, so that the image develops in the presence of ammonia.
--Examples--
--Word--
Ozark Mountains 
--Type--
proper noun
--Meanings--
A heavily forested highland plateau dissected by rivers, valleys, and streams, lying between the Missouri and Arkansas Rivers and within the states of Missouri, Arkansas, Oklahoma, Kansas, and Illinois.
--Examples--
--Word--
Ozark Mountains 
--Type--
proper noun
--Meanings--
A heavily forested highland plateau dissected by rivers, valleys, and streams, lying between the Missouri and Arkansas Rivers and within the states of Missouri, Arkansas, Oklahoma, Kansas, and Illinois.
--Examples--
--Word--
ozaena 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
Medicine. Originally: an ulcer of the nose (or, rarely, other part of the body), especially when accompanied by a fetid discharge; any of various conditions characterized by the presence of such a lesion. Later: specifically a chronic disease of the nose characterized by atrophy of the nasal mucosa and bone, with a thick secretion that forms dry, extremely fetid crusts, often associated with the presence of bacteria of the genus Klebsiella.
--Examples--
--Word--
ozokerite 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
A brown or black paraffin wax occurring naturally in some shales and sandstones and formerly used in candles, polishes, and electrical insulation.

--Examples--
--Word--
ozonation 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
Impregnation or treatment with ozone; reaction with ozone, especially in an ozonolysis process.
--Examples--
--Word--
ozone 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
A colourless unstable toxic gas with a pungent odour and powerful oxidizing properties, formed from oxygen by electrical discharges or ultraviolet light. It differs from normal oxygen (O₂) in having three atoms in its molecule (O₃).
Fresh invigorating air, especially that blowing on to the shore from the sea.
--Examples--
--Word--
ozoned 
--Type--
adjective
--Meanings--
Containing or supplied with ozone. Also informal (of air): fresh and invigorating (misidentified as containing ozone).
US slang. Intoxicated on drugs; ‘high’. Only in predicative use.
--Examples--
--Word--
ozoner 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
A drive-in cinema. More fully "ozoner cinema".

--Meanings--

--Meanings--
--Examples--
--Word--
ozonide 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
Any of a class of unstable cyclic compounds formed by the addition of ozone to a carbon–carbon double bond.
A salt of the anion O₃-, derived from ozone.
--Examples--
--Word--
ozonide 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
Any of a class of unstable cyclic compounds formed by the addition of ozone to a carbon–carbon double bond.
A salt of the anion O₃-, derived from ozone.

--Type--
verb
--Meanings--

--Word--
ozonolysis 
--Type--
noun
--Meanings--
The cleavage of unsaturated carbon–carbon bonds by reaction with ozone.
--Examples--

--Type--
noun

--Word--
Aussie 
--Type--
noun, adjective
--Meanings--
A person from Australia.
Australia.
Australian.
--Examples--
‘he's an Aussie and so he probably played cricket as a kid’
‘this is Australia and we are Ozzies’
‘I was in Auckland for the last few years, but now I live in Aussie’
‘he married an Aussie girl and moved to Australia in 1948’
‘an Aussie accent’
‘the Ozzie government’
